yt30_lp28.sengokugame.serverSide

Class ServerGameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • yt30_lp28.sengokugame.serverSide.ServerGameModel

  • public class ServerGameModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The game model on the server side. This game model (server side) is initiated first. 1. send a game mvc to the client 2. once the client installs the mvc. 3. the game model on server side can send a model to the client to start the game.
    Author:
    yt30, lp28

      • initGameSettings

        public void initGameSettings()

      • playerTakeAction

        Carry out player's action
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of player;
        cityFrom - The base city
        cityTo - the target city
        number - the number of soldier to send

      • updateAfterATurn

        public void updateAfterATurn()
        do the update when a turn finishes: 1. Each player take their individual action using playerTakeAction(); which will affect a cities soldier assignments. 2. The cities are updated based on all soldier assignment (there will be battles if multiple teams reside in the same city). Step 2 is implemented using updateAfterATurn()

      • notifyResult4Turn

        public void notifyResult4Turn()
        Notify the result (new CityIcons) to all players
